intro: Astragalus monbeigii, commonly known as the Monbeig's milkvetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of central Asia, including parts of China and Kazakhstan. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and small, pea-like flowers that range in color from yellow to purple. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several pairs of small, oval-shaped leaflets. Astragalus monbeigii is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments.
